unit_learning_outcomes.description: Work productively in a group to evaluate how major advances in blockchain, machine learning and artificial intelligence are applicable to finance problems.
Explore fundamental techniques in blockchain, machine learning and artificial intelligence
Discover the risks arising from FinTech and understand the dynamics between the innovations and regulations.
Analyse recent developments in FinTech and its impact in transforming the finance industry.
Identify fundamental economic and psychological issues in the current financial system.

enrolment_rules.description: (AFIN6012 and (AFIN613 or AFIN6013)) or (admission to MBkgFin or MBusAnalytics or MFin)

assessments.description: An online open book two hour examination will be held during University Examination Period.
A closed book two hour examination will be held during University Examination Period.
The assignment will cover quantitative and/or qualitative analysis of a finance scenario or problem. Student will be required to produce a report of 800 to 1200 words

The project will cover quantitative and/or qualitative analysis specific to FinTech. In groups of 3-4, students will be required to conduct analysis and produce a business report. Please note that 50% of the marks will be based on student's individual contribution via indidvidual essay and/or presentation.
The project will cover quantitative and/or qualitative analysis specific to FinTech. Student will be required to conduct analysis and produce a business report.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: Technology has been transforming the finance industry, with the potential to disrupt traditional industry structure and practice. This unit introduces the main building blocks of FinTech (blockchain, big data, machine learning and artificial intelligence) and how these technologies could  provide transformative solutions to underlying finance problems (including economic and psychological issues) and  reshape the finance industry with innovations. Cutting-edge cases will be used to illustrate the core concepts.
data.title: FinTech and Innovation

title: FinTech and Innovation
